required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Barriers to Efficient PACU Discharge at a Major Academic Orthopaedic Ambulatory Surgery Center
clinical_study.official_title: Barriers to Efficient PACU Discharge at a Major Academic Orthopaedic Ambulatory Surgery Center

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

clinical_study.source: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective chart review to determine the etiologies contributing to prolonged PACU discharge at a major Orthopedic Ambulatory Center

detailed_description.textblock: Increasing number of surgeries are now performed at ambulatory surgical centers including orthopaedic procedures. While healthier patients usually undergo non-major orthopaedic procedures using regional anesthesia to facilitate faster discharges, prolonged PACU discharges are frequently encountered necessitating characterization and identification of modifiable variables. This is a retrospective chart review to determine the etiologies contributing to prolonged PACU discharge at a major Orthopedic Ambulatory Center.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day of surgery (Day 0) through discharge, average of 6 hours
primary_outcome.description: This is the length of time that patients stay in the recovery room

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day of surgery (Day 0) through discharge, average of 6 hours
secondary_outcome.description: This is the amount of pain medication patients require in the recovery room

arm_group.description: This is a retrospective chart review to determine the etiologies contributing to prolonged PACU discharge at a major Orthopedic Ambulatory Surgical Center.

intervention.description: This is a retrospective chart review to determine the etiologies contributing to prolonged PACU discharge at a major Orthopedic Ambulatory Surgical Center.

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing ambulatory foot and ankle surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (18 years and older) undergoing ambulatory foot and ankle surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- n/a
